item.name: ExtractSeedBasedIntensityWindowFilter
item.description: Extracts the mean intensity values of an image from provided seed locations.

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
The radius of the window to use for the mean intensity extraction.
If enabled, the radius is scaled with respect to the image spacing.
If enabled, the keypoints are scaled with respect to the image spacing.
If larger than zero, used as a threshold, ie only seeds with larger values are saved.

item.name: ParallelSeededWatershedSegmentation
item.description: Applys the TWANG segmentation method on the supplied image as described by Stegmaier et al. Requires seed points as meta information.

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
If true, the filter directly produces a labeled output image with a unique id for each detected blob.
If true, the filter directly uses the seed ids as labels instead of sequential seed numbers.
If checked, random labels are used. Note that random labels might not be unique.
If checked, the region props of extracted blobs are exported to a cvs file.
If checked, the intensity image is inverted (e.g. set to 1 for nuclei and to 0 for membranes.
The seed radius is multiplied by this factor to determine the final ROI radius for the segmentation.

item.name: DiscreteGaussianImageFilter
item.description: Gaussian smothing filter. Filters the image with a gaussian kernel defined by variance.

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
Variance of the gaussian kernel.
Maximum error of the gaussian function approximation.
Maximum kernel size in pixel.
Use the real spacing for the gaussian kernel creation.
Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
Combine separate 2D images to one 3D stack. Drag&drop first file of the series and substitute the series index by %0nd, with n being the number of digits.
Start index for the series reader
End index for the series reader
Index increment for the series reader
Original spacing in the first dimension
Original spacing in the second dimension
Original spacing in the third dimension

item.name: ResampleImageFilter
item.description: Resize the filter according to the specified size or scaling factors.

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
The new width for the image.
The new height for the image.
The new depth for the image.
The scaling factor for the x dimension of the image.
The scaling factor for the y dimension of the image.
The scaling factor for the z dimension of the image.
If enabled, the scaling factors are used for resizing.
0: NearestNeighbor, 1: LinearInterpolation

item.name: RescaleIntensityImageFilter
item.description: Rescales the image from min to max for integer types and from 0 to 1 for float types

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.

item.name: LoGScaleSpaceMaximumProjectionFilter
item.description: Creates the maximum projection of multiple laplacian of gaussian filter results.

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
Step width from min to max sigma.
Minimum sigma value.
Maximum sigma value.
Normalize scales.

item.name: ExtractLocalExtremaFilter
item.description: Extracts all local extrema in an image.

parameter.description: Write output to disk
Write meta data to disk
Define the maximum number of concurrent threads
If set to 1, compression is used for file saving.
Switch between uint8 and uint16 result image types.
Minium value for extrema. If set to -1 an automatic selection based on the mean intensity and the intensity standard deviation are used.
Multiplicator for the standard deviation. If automatic threshold selection is used, all seeds below (mu + StdDevMultiplicator * sigma) are rejected.
If set to a value between 0 and 1, values within the respective quantile are rejected. I.e. if set to 0.95 all seeds with intensity in the 95% quantile are rejected.
Adds an offset to the coordinates of each seed point. E.g. useful for MATLABs 1-based indexing.
0 to search in 2D only, 1 for searching in 3D only and 2 for searching in both 2D and 3D.
The neighborhood radius of the local extrema search.
If detection in 2D and 3D is performed, seeds that were not multiply detected can be rejected.
Fuse extrema that lie within a small radius.
Prefer 3D seeds over 2D seeds. I.e. all 2D seeds that lie within the seed radius of a 3D seed are rejected.
Allow more than one point in a neighborhood to be an extremum.
